sentences.en: He felt an indescribable sensation somewhat akin to dread.
sentences.cn: 他感到一种形容不出的感觉,有点近于恐怖.

sentences.en: He is near akin to us.
Henry's opinion is quite akin to Betty's.
sentences.cn: 亨利的意见类似于贝蒂的.

sentences.en: Inside the bus a silence akin to that in a church.
sentences.cn: 车内一片寂静,有如教堂里的默祷.

sentences.en: Listening to his life story is akin to reading a good adventure novel.
sentences.cn: 听他的人生故事犹如阅读一本精彩的冒险小说。

sentences.en: My friend's feelings are akin to mine.
sentences.cn: 我那位朋友的感受和我相近.

sentences.en: One, akin to nominalism and idealism , finds its expression today in finitism and intuitionism.
sentences.cn: 一种类似于唯名论和观念说, 现在称为有穷论和直觉主义.

sentences.en: Pity and love are closely akin.
She painted flowers and birds pictures akin to those of earlier feminine painters.
sentences.cn: 她画一些同早期女画家类似的花鸟画.

sentences.en: Something akin to panic overwhelmed him.
sentences.cn: 一种近似惊恐的感觉使他不知所措。

sentences.en: The cat is akin to the tiger.
This process is akin to piecing together a jigsaw puzzle.
What he felt was more akin to pity than love.
sentences.cn: 他感受到的更像怜悯，而不是爱。

sentences.en: Your cousins are akin to you.
sentences.cn: 你的堂兄弟和你是同族的.

trans.tran_cn: (Akin)人名；(土、瑞典、尼日利)阿金；(匈)奥金；(英)埃金
